TopicTitle: Boeing P-8 Poseidon [Mostly a replica. I had no choice but to install four engines.]

Articles.Content:
And to the guy impersonating juanxlink, down vote our craft pages however much you want, but remember that the ratings have become meaningless. Congratulations, mr. troll. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![Hkyj73H.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Hkyj73H.jpg)

![AzTT886.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/AzTT886.jpg)

Anyways, here's my Boeing P-8 Poseidon. It's still a work in progress, with aerodynamic refinement on the agenda, but I think this thing flies well for having over 18,000 units of liquid fuel and only four jet engines. Heck, without the four missiles, it cruises at 180 m/s. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

While you're taking off, you have to wait until you reach 50-60 m/s and retract the rearmost impact gear. This will allow you to safely take off.

After you read the instructions above, you can actually fly this huge jet: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/xtxd1fdq6wk3n2r/Poseidon%20Prototype%201_1.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xtxd1fdq6wk3n2r/Poseidon%20Prototype%201_1.craft?dl=0)

I also fixed the slight issue of landing gear explosions in flight. Also, don't fly this thing like a fighter. It flies like the real thing, which is based off of a passenger airliner with an extremely large fuel load.

Its armament consists of four supersonic cruise missiles, a MAD (magnetic anomaly detector) tail boom, and a small bomb bay for the yet to be installed countermeasure cartridge.
